head.title: 2 Men Are Shot Dead on Brooklyn Streets

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: 2 Men Are Shot Dead on Brooklyn Streets
hedline.hl2: 2 Are Shot Dead on Brooklyn Streets

abstract.p: Two men are killed in unrelated shootings on streets of Brooklyn (S)

block.p: Two men were killed in unrelated shootings on Brooklyn streets on Friday night. One was in a wheelchair, and the other was beaten before an attacker shot him, the police said.

In the first shooting, about 7:25 p.m., in front of 140 Tapscott Street, in Brownsville, a 33-year-old man, whom the police did not identify, was chased by three men who beat him, the police said. At least one of the men then shot the man, who had a long history of arrests for mostly minor crimes, a law enforcement official said.
Two men were killed in unrelated shootings on Brooklyn streets on Friday night. One was in a wheelchair, and the other was beaten before an attacker shot him, the police said.
Two men were killed in unrelated shootings on Brooklyn streets on Friday night. One was in a wheelchair, and the other was beaten before an attacker shot him, the police said.

In the first shooting, about 7:25 p.m., in front of 140 Tapscott Street, in Brownsville, a 33-year-old man, whom the police did not identify, was chased by three men who beat him, the police said. At least one of the men then shot the man, who had a long history of arrests for mostly minor crimes, a law enforcement official said.
The second shooting occurred about 8:40 p.m. in front of 1144 Blake Avenue in East New York.
A 23-year-old man whom residents identified as Tyrell Pope was approached by another man, who shot him seven times in the face and upper body, residents and the authorities said.
A resident, Helen Bragg, 69, and other residents said that Mr. Pope used a wheelchair after being shot in the spine several years ago.
